subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: A couple of questions from a newbie
msgSnippet: ... Let us not forget 0. The letters are completely unfamiliar and nobody can read a word of it who hasn t learned it in the same way people learn shorthand.
messageBody:
Vincent Reilly scripsit:

> I see "intelligibility across accent boundaries" as one of 2 big
> problems selling QS to people who really aren't into this , as we
> are. They are:
> 1. The intelligibility problem has already been solved by TO. It's
> standard.
> 2. Writing (unsanctioned) phonetic English is considered uneducated
> or just plain stupid.

Let us not forget

0. The letters are completely unfamiliar and nobody can read a word of it
who hasn't learned it in the same way people learn shorthand.

> The average person is likely to ask why we should even bother with
> QS as general solution for the Anglophone world, or at all?

Indeed.

--
John Cowan cowan@... http://www.ccil.org/~cowan
Any day you [see] all five woodpeckers is a good day. --Elliotte Rusty Harold
